summary.title: 타다 전직 경영진 이재웅 무죄 확정..과거 서비스는 어려울듯
summary.content: Former executives of Tada, a car call service company, and its subsidiaries were acquitted by the Supreme Court after being caught in an illegal call taxi controversy. The Tada Basic service that was provided in the past, which allowed customers to rent 11-seater cars with a driver via a smartphone app, is unlikely to be available again. Tada had claimed that the service was legal as a "car rental business including the provision of articles," but it faced massive protests and revisions to the law that led to the death of a taxi driver in 2018. The verdict did not address the availability of past Tada services, which were illegal, though current Tada services, such as Tada Light and Tada Next, are within the scope of the amended Passenger Automobile Law.

summary.title: '타다 무죄'에 이재웅 전 대표 "혁신은 죄가 없다"
summary.content: Former representative of Soka, Lee Jae-woong took to social media to express that "innovation was not sinful" after being deemed innocent in the Supreme Court. Lee urges that the law should be changed to prevent the interests of vested parties from hindering innovation. Lee further claims that politicians who side with vested interests are afraid of innovation. Despite the growth of an innovation ecosystem, many have lost their jobs and supporters have become an abbreviation for movements again. While Lee was acquitted in the Supreme Court, the Tada Project proposed by Democratic Party Park Hong-geun passed the National Assembly in 2020 making it impossible to resume business.

summary.title: 대법원 '타다' 불법 아니다 확정…이재웅 등 경영진 무죄
summary.content: The Supreme Court of South Korea has ruled that the car calling service Tada is not illegal, and as a result, former executives of the company, including Lee Jae-woong and Park Jae-wook, have been cleared of charges. Tada is a service that allows users to borrow an 11-seater van with a driver. The company VCNC ran a car rental business, which provided rental cars to Tada with the drivers. Lee Jae-woong had argued that the service was legal as a "car rental including knights." He went on to say that this ruling should prevent further attempts to stifle innovation, protect the interests of vested interests, and called for continued innovation in Korean society.

summary.title: 대법도 "'타다' 불법콜택시 아니다"…이재웅 무죄 확정(종합)
summary.content: The South Korean Supreme Court has ruled that the former executives of the ride-hailing service 'Tada' are not guilty of running an illegal taxi service, a case that had been ongoing for four years. The controversial service was based on a core business model of borrowing an eleven-seater car with a driver using a smartphone application. The taxi industry strongly opposed the service, and large protests led to the revision of the law. Although Tada's innocence has been confirmed, the service cannot be resumed, and the passenger car law has been amended to restrict similar services, except for tourist purposes, rental time exceeding six hours, airport or port rentals, and larger vans.

summary.title: “타다, 불법 콜택시 아냐” 이재웅 전 대표 무죄 확정
summary.content: Lee Jae-woong, former representative of Tada, has been found not guilty in the trial regarding the legality of their vehicle call service. The Supreme Court has confirmed that Tada should be considered as a legal car rental service instead of an illegal multi-man-in-one call taxi. Tada Basic was launched in December 2018, allowing users to rent an 11-seater van with a driver through the mobile app. The court dismissed the appeal that the judicial ruling misunderstood the law. Despite being accused of violating the Passenger Vehicle Transportation Business Act, Tada argued that their service was a rental car service rather than a taxi service. The service was ultimately stopped in April 2020 after the Passenger Vehicle Transportation Business Act passed the National Assembly.

summary.title: 대법도 "'타다' 불법 콜택시 아니다"…이재웅 무죄 확정
summary.content: Former executives of Tada, a vehicle call service, have been declared innocent by the Supreme Court of South Korea. While the CEO and Tada operator, Park Jae-wook, were convicted, the Soka and VCNC subsidiary were innocent. The service borrowed a van and was operated by VCNC by lending a car rental from Soka to the customer with the driver. In October 2019, Lee and the former President Park were involved in the controversial case and Tada's defense argued that it was legal as a 'car rental including knights'. The Supreme Court admitted that there was no mistake regarding the interpretation of the old passenger automobile law.

summary.title: ‘불법 논란’ 타다 이재웅 전 대표, 대법서 무죄 확정
summary.content: Former Tada executive Lee Jae-woong and operator Park Jae-wook were cleared of violating the Passenger Automobile Transportation Business Act by the South Korean Supreme Court. Tada's core business model involved renting out 11-seater vans with drivers through a smartphone application. This led to controversy in 2018 when the taxi industry called it an "illegal call taxi." Tada was later banned from operating as an "illegal call taxi service" in October 2019. Lee Jae-woong and Park Jae-wook accepted the charges and were sentenced to innocence. The Supreme Court ruled that their judgment was based on sound legal reasoning and was not a misunderstanding of the law.

summary.title: [속보] ‘타다’ 이재웅 前대표 무죄 확정
summary.content: Former president and operator of the vehicle call service, Tada, Lee Jae-woong, has been found not guilty in the trial for "illegal call taxi" in the Supreme Court. Tada operator VCNC Park Jae-wook and subsidiary Soca were also declared innocent. The prosecution accused Tada Basic of being an "illegal call taxi service" prohibited under the old passenger automobile law and filed charges against Lee and President Lee in October 2019. However, Tada insisted that it was legal as a "car rental service". The Supreme Court ruled that there was no mistake in the judgment and that there was a misunderstanding of the law regarding the interpretation of the old passenger automobile law.

summary.title: ‘불법 콜택시 논란’ 타다 무죄 확정…이재웅 “혁신은 죄 없어”
summary.content: The Supreme Court in South Korea declared Tada service innocent in the controversial case of providing illegal call taxi services. Tada provided a service that allowed a car rental company to rent a car to a customer with a driver through a smartphone application. The company claimed that it was operating legally as a car rental service and not as an illegal taxi service. Tada earned 26.8 billion won by "transporting paid passengers" despite the car rental company prohibiting the transportation of passengers by paying a business car. The amendment to the Passenger Automobile Law suspended Tada's service. However, Tada insisted that it was a legal rental of automobiles, including knights. Finally, the Supreme Court declared Tada innocent, and VCNC Park Jae-wook stated that "innovation is not a crime," and he hoped that the ruling would serve as an opportunity for future innovators to overcome resistance from vested interests and create innovation essential for society.

analyze.fact_summary: 타다는 11인승 차량을 빌려드리는 서비스를 제공하는데 있어 불법 콜택시로 분류되어 논란이 있었다. 이에 대한 소송에서 대표인 이재웅 등 경영진은 무죄 판결을 받았으며, 서비스는 정보통신망 이용촉진 및 정보보호 등에 관한 법률에서 제공하는 콜택시 대신 차량 대여 업과 비슷한 법적 지위를 가졌기 때문에 현재의 서비스는 관련 법률 내에 합법적인 것으로 간주된다.
analyze.easy_summary: 타다는 11인승 차량을 대여해주는 서비스를 제공하는데, 이들이 불법 콜택시 서비스를 제공하는 것으로 분류되어 논란이 있었습니다. 하지만 최고법원에서 대표인 이재웅 등 경영진이 무죄 판결을 받았으며, 현재는 콜택시와 다른 법적 지위를 가진 차량 대여 업으로 간주되어 합법적으로 운영되고 있습니다.

summary.title: 대법 “2015년 ‘한일 위안부 합의’ 협상문서 비공개 정당”
summary.content: The Supreme Court in South Korea has ruled that the negotiations document related to the 2015 'comfort women agreement' with Japan can remain classified, meaning it won't be disclosed to the public. The documents contain sensitive information such as whether the Korean government recognized the extent to which the Japanese military was involved in the issue of comfort women, forced performance, sex slavery, and the term "Japanese comfort women," which are all highly controversial issues in Korean-Japanese relations. The Supreme Court declared that the decision was in the interest of national security and that the plaintiffs' defeat in their lawsuit against the Minister of Foreign Affairs was justified. The 2015 agreement brought an apology from Japan's foreign minister, Fumio Kishida, and acknowledged that there was "military involvement" in the issue of comfort women, which was irreversible and conclusive.

summary.title: 대법 "'위안부 합의안' 비공개"…송기호 "외교관계라고 너무 소극적"
summary.content: The South Korean Supreme Court has decided not to disclose the content of the comfort women agreement made between Korea and Japan in 2015. The third division of the Supreme Court stated that diplomatic negotiations cannot be revealed, and it is the duty of the judiciary to guarantee the human rights of the victims. The agreement included the acknowledgement of the Japanese military's involvement in the issue of comfort women, but phrases such as "military involvement" and "sex slavery" were private in the talks. The court's decision has been criticized by a lawyer for a democratic society who stated that the court should actively maintain the minimum rule of law and not be too passive on diplomatic relations.

summary.title: 대법 “한일 위안부 합의 협상문서 비공개는 정당”
summary.content: South Korea's Supreme Court has ruled that the government's decision to not disclose a document related to negotiations for the 'Korea-Japan Comfort Agreement' was justified. The case was filed in 2016 when the government refused to release a document on the negotiating process for the agreement. The plaintiffs, including comfort women victims, argued that the document was necessary for their right to know. However, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs argued that the document contained matters related to diplomatic trust between the two countries and could harm the state's interests. The Supreme Court's ruling was criticized by lawyers who argued that it failed to recognize the Japanese government's legal responsibility.

summary.title: 대법 "한일 위안부 합의 협상문서 공개 안 돼"
summary.content: The South Korean Supreme Court has ruled that the government was justified in not disclosing negotiations related to the 2015 Korea-Japan comfort women agreement. The court ruled against an appeal by the plaintiffs that the documents should be revealed, stating that such disclosure could seriously damage diplomatic relations between the two countries. The agreement contained an apology by the then-Japanese Prime Minister Abe, but words such as 'involvement of the military' and 'sex slavery' were not included in the public version of the document. While it was judged that it would be correct to disclose the issue of the victims, it was considered that releasing the details of the negotiations would not be in the country's significant interests.

summary.title: 대법 "2015년 한일 위안부 합의 문서 비공개 정당"(종합)
summary.content: The Supreme Court in South Korea has ruled that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs was justified in not disclosing documents related to the 2015 Korea-Japan comfort women's negotiations. The court confirmed that the Information Disclosure Act states that disclosure may harm the state's significant interests in matters of national security, defense, unification, and diplomatic relations. During the Park Geun-hye administration, both countries had declared the comfort women issue in Japan as finalized and irreversible. The lawyer for plaintiffs argued that the people's right to know outweighed the country's interests protected by information, especially as it concerned a matter of deprivation of physical freedom, and debt not protected for comfort women victims. However, the court found that the non-disclosure profits of private diplomatic negotiations outweigh the benefits of disclosure. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said there was a need to maintain a close relationship with Japan towards safeguarding mutual military support agreement (GSOMIA).

summary.title: 대법 "2015년 한일 위안부 합의 협상문서 비공개 정당"(종합)
summary.content: The Supreme Court of South Korea has ruled that the negotiation document related to the 'comfort women agreement' between Korea and Japan in 2015 did not need to be disclosed to the public. The court dismissed the appeal made by the plaintiff, attorney Song Ki-ho, who had argued to cancel the non-disclosure decision against the Foreign Minister. The court maintained its previous position of being cautious regarding the disclosure of diplomatic negotiations, stating that revealing the document could damage diplomatic trust between the two countries. Japan denies the forced mobilization of comfort women during World War II.

summary.title: 대법 "2015년 한일 위안부 합의 협상문서 비공개 정당"
summary.content: The South Korean Supreme Court has ruled that the negotiations for the "comfort women agreement" between South Korea and Japan in 2015 can remain undisclosed. The court justified its decision by stating that the public's right to know and public interest did not outweigh the interests of the nation that could be protected with the private document. A lawyer, Song Ji-sung, and Korean-Japanese foreign ministers had filed a lawsuit in February 2016 to disclose the negotiation document that discussed the comfort women issue. The Supreme Court dismissed Song's claim and ultimately agreed with the second judgment.

summary.title: 대법 "2015년 한일 위안부 합의 협상 문서 비공개 정당"
summary.content: The Supreme Court in South Korea has ruled that the negotiation document linked to the 2015 comfort women agreement between Japan and South Korea must remain confidential. The Court supported the government’s position, which cites the sensitivity of the issue as well as concerns about diplomatic relations and trust between the two countries. There was concern during the legal process that the agreement would damage human rights of victims if the judiciary did not intervene. The ruling means that the document, which addressed issues relating to the forced conscription of Korean women during World War II, will not be released to the public.

summary.title: 대법 “2015년 한일 위안부 합의 협상문서 비공개 정당”
summary.content: The South Korean Supreme Court has ruled that the negotiation documents pertaining to the 2015 Korea-Japan comfort women agreement are confidential. In February 2016, a lawsuit was filed to disclose the negotiation documents related to the forced sexual enslavement of Korean women by Japanese soldiers during World War II. While the second trial ruled for the disclosure of the documents, the Supreme Court reversed the decision, stating that such documents may affect diplomatic trust and the consultation process of other treaties with other countries. The ruling shows the Supreme Court's caution in disclosing the negotiations of diplomatic agreements signed by South Korea and other countries. Documents relating to the GSOMIA agreement and mutual military support agreement data are also considered confidential under the law on the disclosure of public institution information.

summary.content: A woman in her twenties in South Korea was arrested for the murder and abandonment of a dead body. summary.content: A woman in her 20s has confessed to murdering a peer woman she met through a tutoring application in Busan. The accused stated she was interested in criminal investigation programs and planning the murder, as she felt the urge to kill. The victim was approached by the accused, pretending to be a middle school student for English tutoring. After the murder, the accused planned to abandon the body along with the victim's cell phone and ID. The police are yet to confirm the accused's psychopath status and will hold a personal information disclosure deliberation committee to decide whether to disclose her identity. The accused is expected to be sent to prosecution for murder as early as tomorrow.

summary.title: '부산 또래살인' 피의자 자백…"살인해 보고 싶어서"
summary.content: A 23-year-old woman named A has admitted to killing her peer, B, and then damaging and abandoning the body in Busan, South Korea. According to the police, A felt a desire to murder and searched for it on her phone and borrowed crime-related novels from a library. A used a tutoring app to find a tutor who lives alone, deceived her victim by pretending to need tutoring and then stabbed her. A was caught after taking B's cell phone, ID, and wallet to the body organic site to disguise her as if she was missing. A is scheduled to appear before the 'New Information Disclosure Deliberation Committee' for her personal information to be disclosed.

summary.title: "살인해보고 싶어서"...또래 여성 살해 20대女 진술 '충격'
summary.content: A woman in her 20s has been arrested for murdering another woman who was her colleague at a part-time job in Busan, South Korea. The suspect, identified as "A," told the police that she had been interested in committing a murder, stating "I actually wanted to murder". Investigators found evidence on her mobile phone that she had been searching for terms like 'murder', 'murderless murder', and 'murder case'. The suspect, who had no special job after high school, contacted the victim by pretending to be a parent seeking a tutor and visited her at home. The victim's body was found near the Nakdong River, and the suspect confessed to the crime. The police are still investigating whether to disclose further details about the case.

summary.title: 또래여성 살해 20대女 “살인해보고 싶어서”...교복까지 갈아입고 범행 계획?
summary.content: A woman in her 20s, identified as Mr. A, has been charged with killing a peer of the same age in Busan, South Korea. She was found to have committed the murder intentionally due to a desire to do so prompted by an interest in murder-related content on television and the internet. The crime was not an accidental but instead, a premeditated attack on their victim as evidenced by the victim's purchases of both a school uniform on an internet site and a bag used to dispose of the victim's body. The culprit used a tutoring app to locate and visit the victim under the guise of being a parent whose child required tutoring, talked with the victim for a short while, to immediately attack and kill them. The arrested suspect lives with her grandfather, did not attend college after graduating from high school, and has been unemployed for the past three years. The case will now move to a new public committee before moving to the prosecution.

summary.title: 부산 또래 여성 살해 20대 “살인 충동 때문에 죽였다”
summary.content: In South Korea, a woman in her 20s was murdered by another woman through an extracurricular brokerage app. The murderer confessed that she committed the crime due to her murder impulse. The police found that the murderer had been searching for murder-related contents three months prior to the crime. Two days before the incident, she searched for victims in the tutoring app and found the victim, whom she later visited wearing a school uniform purchased online. The murderer then abandoned parts of the victim's body in a travel bag near a riverbank. The police discovered the bag after a taxi driver reported it. The murderer later confessed that she abandoned the body to disguise it as a missing person case.

summary.title: "교복 입고 피해자 찾아가" 또래 살해 20대 여성, 계획범행 정황
summary.content: A 20-year-old woman in Busan, South Korea, planned and carried out the murder of a peer woman she met through an extracurricular brokerage app. Police discovered that the suspect, known as "A", searched for terms like "dead murder" and "murder case" before committing the crime. She also borrowed a crime-related novel from a library in Busan. After killing the victim, "B", A stopped at a mart to purchase items to conceal the crime, including vinyl, rocks, and weapons. It's believed that A approached B under false pretenses, asking for a tutor for her children and visiting B's house in a school uniform. The police are considering the possibility that the crime was premeditated based on A's actions and searches before and after the murder. Today, a personal information disclosure deliberation committee will be held to determine if A's identity will be made public.

summary.title: 부산 또래 여성 살해 20대 "살인 충동 때문에 범행 저질렀다"
summary.content: A woman in her 20s from Busan confessed to killing her peers and damaging and abandoning the body due to her "murder impulse." She was arrested on the suspicion of killing and damaging the body. The woman was interested in murder through media and the internet and searched for victims on a tutoring app, pretending to be a parent. She then brought a travel bag from her home and abandoned some of the damaged body. In a police investigation, she stated that she decided to abandon the body to disguise herself as missing.

In March 20121, Lee Young -ha, who had been suspected of school width during the Sunlin Internet High School, eventually had a legal dispute since August last year.The damages were reported to the Sports Ethics Center, and the prosecution was prosecuted.Doosan, who grasped the case, excluded Lee Young -ha from the first -team entry, and this season, he left him as a 'unemployed holder'.It's not true at all, ”Lee Young -ha insisted innocent through various context evidence during the trial process.Eventually, the facts that did not match the claim of the damage were taken off in the first trial, and Doosan signed a contract with Lee Young -ha the same day.The company agreed to announce the salary of 120 million won, which is 40 million won lower than last year (160 million won).The club promised to preserve four months of salary from February to May.Expectations and consideration for Lee Young -ha are seen at the same time.He joins the team on the 1st, and Lee Young -ha has played a variety of roles in Doosan Mound and has played an aloran player.In 2016, he joined Doosan and made his debut in the following year.He was ranked second in the second consecutive year (2018-2019) for two consecutive years.In 2020, he was sluggish in the first half (average ERA of 5.62), but in the second half, he worked as a finishing pitcher and recorded an average ERA of 2.96 with 6 saves.In 2021, the bullpen showed a low average ERA of 1.60. The problem was a ups and downs.While playing a shot during the game, it was shaken and collapsed at any point, and it was the same in the season.In the case of last year, he collapsed in two games after collapsing three innings (7 ERAs) in Jamsil NC on April 28, but he shaken again with eight runs (three ERAs) in Jamsil SSG on May 17.Afterwards, the average ERA, which was 6.23 at the end of April, went down to three points (July 5, 3.98), but eventually rose to 4.93. Kim Tae -hyung (56)The current SBS sports commentator expressed his regret about Lee Young -ha's 'roller coaster' temperament."The ball is good," he praised Lee Young -ha's status, but "Mental is shaking. He can't be centered."It was a truly 'existence of love', while the Doosan Command Tower changed to 'National batter' Lee Seung -yeop (47) while Lee Young -ha complained of innocence in court.Lee said at the inauguration ceremony in October last year, "I want to solve it quickly and return to the team. The most important thing is to give a sincere apology and reconciliation to the victims."After hearing the news of the sentence, the director said, "I think it's a quiet state."He said, "I want to focus on baseball, not thinking anything else now.""I was innocent, but it was not a good thing for a professional player," Lee said. "I think that life in the future will be more important. I hope to be an exemplary player."'In the first season, Lee Young is going to start as a salvation pitcher.Lee said, "I haven't been together since Spring Camp.""If I return now, I would have to go to salvation," he thought.However, there are certain standards.Lee said, "I have been reported that I have a bullpen pitch now," he said. "If you have a contract, you will start in the second group, and if you think it's okay, I will call it (in the first group)."Lee Young -ha, who was caught up and became aware of.Recognized for innocence in court, he now returned to the team and left the glory of the past.

summary.title: 이영하 복귀전 최고 구속 149㎞…무죄 받고 "몸 잘 만들었다" 자신감, 허풍 아니었다
summary.content: South Korean baseball player Lee Young-ha, who was accused of school violence, has returned to the field after being found innocent. Lee threw a fastball pitch at 149 km/h in his first game back in the Futures League after a 10-month gap. He made eight salvation with the Hanwha Eagles and threw six balls, including a three-person defeat with one strikeout. The prosecution previously sentenced Lee to two years in prison, but he was declared innocent due to insufficient evidence. Despite the setback, Doosan Bears signed a salary contract with Lee after the first trial.

summary.content: South Korean baseball team Doosan signed a new contract with Lee Young-ha, who was cleared of school violence allegations. The 40 million-won reduction from the previous year’s salary was offset by special provisions, including retroactive payments and compensation for lost time. The new contract is worth 120 million won. Lee Young-ha is expected to regain his form after paying off retroactives. He recently had a successful performance, pitching a scoreless inning in a game against Hanwha and Futures League. Doosan hopes Lee Young-ha can contribute as a high-level bullpen pitcher.

He pitched a maximum of 149km and showed a good mix of cut fastball and fork balls. Lee Young-ha was evaluated as being in a good condition without any physical limitations. He was recently acquitted of school violence by the Seoul Western District Court. Lee Young-ha has been working on personal training at Icheon Bears Park and his pace has been raised for bullpen pitches. He signed a salary contract with the club office of Jamsil Stadium, after last year's contract was decreased from 160 million won to 40 million won.

summary.title: '학폭 무죄→1억2000만원 계약' 두산 이영하, 퓨처스 첫 등판 1이닝 공 6개로 순삭
summary.content: Lee Young-ha, a baseball player for Doosan, has made his first appearance on the mound at a Futures game. Lee had been accused of school violence but was found not guilty by the court. He had been preparing for his season with personal training and bullpens. He signed a contract with Doosan for a salary of 120 million won, which was reduced to 40 million won, and unpaid salary for four months. He pitched one inning and retired all three hitters he faced. Kim Ji-yong took over after Lee and finished the game.

summary.title: '학교폭력 무죄 판결' 자유 찾은 이영하, 곧바로 실전 돌입…공 6개로 삼자범퇴
summary.content: Lee Young-ha, a baseball player for Doosan Bears, has returned to the game after being cleared of school violence charges. He signed a salary contract with Doosan Bears last month after being accused of special assault, coercion, and blackmail. The prosecution sentenced him to two years in prison, but he was found innocent due to insufficient evidence. Lee Young-ha pitched only six notes in one inning during his comeback game and is set to return as a starting pitcher. He aims to focus on baseball and be an example for the team and students.

summary.title: 김태형의 '애증의 이름' 이영하, 이승엽호에선 '학폭' 털고 기복없는 모습 보여줘라
summary.content: The article reports that Doosan Bears pitcher Lee Young-ha has been cleared of allegations of school violence at the Seoul Western District Court. Doosan Bears initially excluded him from the team and kept him as an "unemployed holder" before he was cleared. Lee Young-ha has signed a contract with Doosan and will make ₩120 million this year. He has shown ups and downs in his performance, but baseball commentator Kim Tae-hyung praised his talent while noting his personality inconsistencies and lack of focus. Lee Seung-yeop has returned to Doosan Bears as the "national batter" while Lee Young-ha was dealing with the legal disputes. The article concludes with Lee Young-ha's determination to move forward and be an exemplary player.

summary.content: South Korean baseball player, Lee Young-ha, who was accused of school bullying, was acquitted at a court trial. Meanwhile, Lee Seung-yeop, another baseball player, expressed his desire to focus on baseball and be an example to young students. Lee is preparing to return to the first team. The manager confirmed that if Lee performs well in the Futures team, he will be called up to the first group, specifically to join the bullpen. Additionally, there was some controversy regarding Kim Yu-sung, who was withdrawn by NC due to his involvement in school violence, but later nominated by Doosan in the 2023 draft.

analyze.fact_summary: 이영하는 학폭의 혐의로 기소되어 유죄 판결을 받았으나, 부족한 증거로 무죄 판결을 받고 복귀했다. 이후 두산베어스와 새로운 계약을 맺었으며, 퓨처스 경기에서 뛰어난 선발력을 보였다.
analyze.easy_summary: 이영하는 학교폭력 혐의로 재판을 받았지만, 증거 부족으로 무죄 판결을 받았고, 복귀했다. 이후 두산베어스와 계약하며, 퓨처스 경기에서 좋은 모습을 보였다.
